intro: Patabea tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered patabea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, delicate flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
